text.section: In Part IV of this subtitle, "hair dye" does not mean eyelash dye or eyebrow dye.

A coal tar hair dye is not considered adulterated under subsection (b)(1) of this section if it:
Has on its label a conspicuously displayed warning that states: "Caution -- This product contains ingredients which may cause skin irritation on certain individuals and a preliminary test according to accompanying directions should first be made. This product must not be used for dyeing the eyelashes or eyebrows; to do so may cause blindness."; and
Has on its labeling adequate directions for the preliminary testing that is referenced on the label.
